pros: Excellent culture with a supportive team!
cons: Can be very busy at times but this is balanced by a flexible work environment and promotion of work/life balance.

pros: - Welcoming culture, they actually care about a work life balance and practice that mentality rather than just saying they do. - Very diverse company to work for. They celebrate other cultures and have specific days off for staff to celebrate. - Recently implemented a 4 day work week.
cons: Benefits are good but maybe a health and wellness account would be a plus.

pros: Good pay. work life balance
cons: work life balance can be tough at busy months

job_title: Academic Support Specialist in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Great place for work/life balance.
cons: Not great at communicating, most people don’t really know what their job duties are, which causes unnecessary confusion

review_title: Great place to work before COVID
pros:
Family atmosphere 
Great location
Good management
cons: COVID allowed many mistakes with staff decisions

review_title: Robertson College is pressuring employees to review them positively on Glass Door
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Winnipeg, MB
pros: There is very little to appreciate, although the LMS system is solid
cons:
- They do not pay you hourly, they pay you per class you teach and they add A LOT of "extras" (like mandatory meetings, prep work that is unpaid for, etc)
- They routinely change the expectations, often times with new expectations conflicting with previous ones
- You are not assessed on your skills or knowledge as an instructor but rather on how well you toe the party line, build your courses online or how well you use the tools that the LMS provides. 
- Your supervisors typically aren't familiar with the subjects you teach, so their feedback and requests are unrelated to the reality of the courses that you teach
- They pressure you to leave positive reviews on Glass Door

review_title: It's a new Robertson and a new day!
job_title: Director, Human Resources in Winnipeg, MB
pros: We have a high performing and talented team who are focused on learning and growing together as we deliver leading, market relevant, quality education and student experience.
cons: Be prepared to work hard but that can be very rewarding.

job_title: Director, Student Recruitment & Admissions in Edmonton, AB
pros:
The Executive team are supportive and encourage growth and development. The culture amongst staff and students is amazing.
- Innovated 
- Energized
- Team Support
- Growth/Development
- Fantastic Leadership all around
- Great Environment to work in
cons: There are any cons in my eyes. I love the company I'm working for.

pros: This company is not afraid of change, they welcome it! It's different day-to day, great collaboration and vision in how to deliver education adult learners will welcome.
cons: Nothing to note at this time!

pros: Great company to work for with opportunity for growth if that is what you want. Colleagues both on Campus and in other locations are fun and professional.
cons: A fast-changing company as the industry is shifting, you have to be comfortable with change.

pros: Values employees, Provides great support, Multi-cultural environment, and Easy to commute with public transportations- right at the bus stop
cons: Heavy workload and Inconvenient parking- Downtown

review_title: By far the best place I've ever worked. It's not even close.

pros: Good work culture and good people for pros

job_title: Home Health Aide in Brandon, MB
pros: Good.. i learned everything and was top of my class
cons: Needs more discipline for no shows

pros:
1. Instructor was a genius and incredible at what he did. I have HIM to thank for my career, not the school.
2. Lenient in terms of finance and paying for tuition.
cons:
1. Fools seem to be in charge. Can be very anti student even though their 14k in tuition gives them their paychecks.
2. cut programs due to lack of students enrolling, then blame it on the course not being sought after - meanwhile all the school does is promote their health courses.
3. The school is incredibly frugal in terms of student benefits. 
4. Probably the only place that does not allow access to wifi.
5. heavily monitors internet, blocking you from accessing pretty much anything.
6. Internet speed is brutal and will often just stop working.
7. IT department has some of the biggest tools you will come across.
8. Just overall a negative environment outside the class.
9. Go to red river college instead.

pros: Great Director, Benefits, Central Location, loved helping the students
cons: The salary didn't justify the work. High stress. Very unorganized. The Head office does not value the Edmonton campus. You have to pay for your own parking, which is more than 300 a month.

pros: What pros....that word does not exist there!
cons:
- Asked to work 24 hours a day
- Employees constantly blamed for managements bad decisions and asked to clean up their mess.
- People with no credibility promoted into roles that they clearly do not know how to do. Unqualified people obsessed with their roles and position of power that they take advantage of everything and everyone around them to assert their dominance.
This place is a disaster from the lies they sell students to the amount of pressure they put on their staff to herd students in and out of their school.
They enforce sales in admissions through passive aggressive (at times assertive) threats.
Favoritism.
Essentially everything you dread when working in an office environment happens here. They treat their staff as if they are slaves and on top of it expect you to work around the clock with absolutely no compensation.
I would describe Managements rein over their instructors and Admissions staff as NEW WORLD SLAVERY or WORKPLACE COMMUNISM. 
Staff are asked to completely for go their own moral compass to make a sale off vulnerable people looking to better their lives but clearly no in a position to take out loans etc.
Due to Robertson's lack of enrollments and not meeting budgets they have decided to fire more staff and continue to pump money into marketing and managerial positions...yet still they end up at the bottom. 
On top of all of this they allow bullying and harassment by staff members.
This is all to be expected when you round up a bunch of people and threaten their livelihood daily...it's survival of the fittest. 
IF I COULD HAVE GIVEN THEM ZERO STARS I WOULD HAVE!

pros: im no longer working for them
cons: Years ago, the company was caring for the staff and employees. Now upper management has cut many of the people who cared about the name and status of the college and students. They run a skeleton crew with minimum pay. I feel sorry for the students who decided to enroll here as they will no doubt be unsatisfied with quality of instruction and how they will be treated here. Upper management only cares about numbers, customer service has gone out the door.

pros: Great job that is very rewarding. Staff is friendly, helpful and feels like a family.
cons: There isn`t a lot of training.  It`s a sink or swim style of environment.

pros: The students and the majority of co-workers.
cons: Leadership of the college.
